content.text:
# Draft:Star Wars: The Clone Wars season 6

Cast
Main
* Matt Lanter as Anakin Skywalker: a Jedi Knight and key figure in the Clone Wars.
* James Arnold Taylor as Obi-Wan Kenobi: a Jedi Master and mentor to Anakin.
* Dee Bradley Baker as Clone Troopers: soldiers cloned from Jango Fett, serving the Republic.
* Matthew Wood as Battle Droids: robotic soldiers used by the Separatists.
* Tom Kane as narrator provides opening narration for each episode, and as Yoda, Grand Master of the Jedi Order.
Recurring
* Corey Burton as Count Dooku / Darth Tyranus: a Sith Lord and leader of the Separatists.
* Tim Curry / Ian Abercrombie as Palpatine / Darth Sidious: Supreme Chancellor of the Republic and secret Sith Lord.
* Terrence C. Carson as Mace Windu: a high-ranking Jedi Master.
* R2-D2 as R2-D2: an astromech droid assisting the Jedi.
Guest
* Dee Bradley Baker as Admiral Trench: a tactical Harch admiral serving the Separatists.
* Anna Graves as Tiplar and Tiplee: twin Jedi Generals in the Republic army.
* Tom Kane as Wullf Yularen: an admiral in the Republic Navy.
* Gwendoline Yeo as Nala Se: a Kaminoan scientist overseeing clone development.
* Tasia Valenza as Shaak Ti: a Jedi Master stationed on Kamino.
* Bob Bergen as Lama Su: Prime Minister of Kamino.
* Ben Diskin as AZ-3: a medical droid assisting in clone research.
* Stephen Stanton as Mas Amedda: Vice Chair of the Galactic Senate.
* Robin Atkin Downes as Rush Clovis: a Republic senator with ties to the Separatists.
* Phil LaMarr as Clu Lesser: a member of the Galactic Senate.
* Stephen Stanton as Mak Plain: a Republic official.
* Corey Burton as Nix Card: a corrupt senator involved in banking deregulation.
* Ashley Moynihan as Teckla Minnau: Padmé Amidala’s handmaiden.
* Dave Filoni as Embo: a bounty hunter known for his agility and unique hat.
* Catherine Taber as Padmé Amidala: a senator and former queen of Naboo.
* Phil LaMarr as Zinn Paulness: a senator allied with the Republic.
* Gideon Emery as Lott Dod: a Neimoidian senator from the Trade Federation.
* Phil LaMarr as Bail Organa: senator of Alderaan and supporter of the Jedi.
* James C. Mathis III as Gregar Typho: head of security for Senator Amidala.
* Corey Burton as Bec Lawise: a Separatist senator.
* Anna Graves as Meena Tills: a Mon Calamari senator.
* Ahmed Best as Jar Jar Binks: Gungan representative and ally to Padmé.
* Ami Shukla as Queen Julia: ruler of the planet Bardotta.
* Cas Anvar as Frangawl Leader: head of a cult on Bardotta.
* Paul Nakauchi as Savatte: a Bardottan official.
* Cas Anvar as Peteen: a member of the Frangawl cult.
* James Arnold Taylor as Joseph: a Bardottan advisor.
* Barbara Goodson as Mother Talzin: leader of the Nightsisters and powerful witch.
* James Arnold Taylor as Plo Koon: a wise and composed Jedi Master.
* Ian Ruskin as Finis Valorum: the former Supreme Chancellor before Palpatine.
* Flo DiRe as Jocasta Nu: Jedi Temple librarian.
* Brian George as Ki-Adi-Mundi: a Cerean Jedi Master and Council member.
* Brian George as Lom: a Republic bureaucrat.
* Brian George as Silman: a Republic aide who vanished during a secret mission.
* Liam Neeson as Qui-Gon Jinn: a deceased Jedi Master who speaks through the Force.
* Catherine Taber as Rig Nema: a Jedi healer.
* Olivia Hack as Katooni: a young Jedi Padawan.
* Ashley Eckstein as Ahsoka Tano: Anakin’s former Padawan.
* Paul Nakauchi as Sifo-Dyas: a Jedi Master who commissioned the clone army.
* Jaime King as The Five Priestesses: ethereal beings representing aspects of the Force.
* Mark Hamill as Darth Bane: an ancient Sith Lord who established the Rule of Two.
Episodes
|released=y |episodes=
| ProdCode        = 5.12
| ShortSummary    = Clone Trooper Tup is suffering from a severe neurological disorder that causes him to shoot a Jedi Master dead. Trying to find the motives for the murder, the Republic escorts Tup back to Kamino for examination, but then they are attacked by the Separatists, who capture him. Anakin, Captain Rex and ARC Trooper Fives rescue Tup and take him to Kamino safely.
| LineColor       = E0BD11
}}
| ProdCode        = 5.13
| ShortSummary    = Tup is undergoing a medical examination in the sterile laboratories of Kamino to find the motives for his shocking attack on the Jedi Master. For the examination to succeed, Fives must enter the depth of Tup's mind, where he finds a secret code manipulation in the cloning program of the Republic. The inhibitor chip is successfully removed, but Tup dies shortly after.
| LineColor       = E0BD11
}}
| ProdCode        = 5.14
| ShortSummary    = Tup is transported back to Coruscant, where his body is to be examined by the Chancellor's personal physician. Fives is also investigating the matter and discovers that a modified code has been hidden in the minds of all the clones.
| LineColor       = E0BD11
}}
| ProdCode        = 5.15
| ShortSummary    = In an effort to find more answers about Tup's actions, Fives attempts to speak with Chancellor Palpatine personally, only to find himself on the run. While unsuccessfully explaining what he learned to Anakin Skywalker and Rex, Fives is shot and killed by Commander Fox.
| LineColor       = E0BD11
}}
| ProdCode        = 4.19
| ShortSummary    = While on a mercy mission to the planet Scipio, Padmé Amidala's old flame Rush Clovis gets in touch with her asking for help. Having made a stand against the corruption on his planet, Clovis has now become the target of the bounty hunter Embo. Together with Padmé, he is now trying to leave his planet and get help.
| LineColor       = E0BD11
}}
| ProdCode        = 4.20
| ShortSummary    = Back on Coruscant, Clovis strikes a dubious deal to become the leader of the banking clan, which is deeply mired in corruption. Anakin doesn't trust Clovis, causing tensions in his relationship to Padmé.
| LineColor       = E0BD11
}}
| ProdCode        = 4.21
| ShortSummary    = Clovis' deal with the Separatists backfires and consequently brings the war to Scipio, thus provoking the Republic to intervene and ultimately win the battle. In the midst of the chaos, Anakin confronts Clovis just as the duo and Padmé are caught in a blast—with Anakin barely managing to cling onto the other two when they virtually fall to their death. Though he intended to pull both up to safety, Anakin merely saves Padmé when Clovis allows himself to be killed.
| LineColor       = E0BD11
}}
| ProdCode        = 5.16
| ShortSummary    = The peaceful world of Bardotta finds itself threatened by an ancient prophecy. Since now, of all times, its spiritual leaders have vanished, Bardotta's people ask their representative in the senate for help. And Jar Jar Binks indeed manages to convince Jedi Master Mace Windu that this matter is of grave importance.
| LineColor       = E0BD11
}}
| ProdCode        = 5.17
| ShortSummary    = In order to fulfill a dark prophecy, a mysterious cult kidnaps Julia, queen of the planet Bardotta. Now, Jedi Master Mace Windu and Senate Representative Jar Jar Binks need to give everything in order to stop the cult. If they fail, the cult might unleash a dreadful force.
| LineColor       = E0BD11
}}
| ProdCode        = 5.18
| ShortSummary    = Jedi Master Sifo-Dyas died under mysterious circumstances years ago. When a secret Jedi mission accidentally finds his crashed ship and lightsaber, Anakin Skywalker, Obi-Wan Kenobi, and Master Yoda investigate Sifo-Dyas's death again. To keep them from uncovering the Sith conspiracy, Darth Sidious orders Dooku to erase all traces that links up to the murder investigation. This is successful and Dooku escapes shortly after Obi-Wan and Anakin learn that he was the one who killed Sifo-Dyas under his Sith alias "Darth Tyranus". Now knowing that Dooku had a hand in creating the clone army, the Jedi decide to keep the knowledge to themselves to avoid widespread panic and confusion until they know more.
| LineColor       = E0BD11
}}
| ProdCode        = 5.19
| ShortSummary    = Yoda is deeply unsettled when he hears the voice of his deceased friend Qui-Gon Jinn in his head, because he knows that not even a Jedi can speak to the living from beyond the grave. The Jedi Council is concerned about Yoda's behavior and wants to examine him further. But with the help of Anakin, Yoda escapes from the hospital and he sets out to find the origin of the voice by himself.
| LineColor       = E0BD11
}}
| ProdCode        = 5.20
| ShortSummary    = Guided by the Force, Yoda travels to the heart of the galaxy. There, on the planet where he finds the origin of the Force, he must face difficult trials. Only upon passing them will the Sages deem him worthy of learning the deepest mysteries of the Force.
| LineColor       = E0BD11
}}
| ProdCode        = 5.21
| ShortSummary    = On Moraband, the homeworld of the Sith, the time has come for Yoda to pass his final test. Only then will he learn the best-kept secret of his order, but first he encounters a vision that heavily foreshadows what is to come—which involves Yoda facing the spirit of Darth Bane. During this time, Darth Sidious summons Count Dooku to his hideout whereupon the duo plan to break Yoda—which stages an inevitable confrontation in the realm of the mind, between the Sith Lords and Yoda alongside Skywalker and his squad. Yoda realizes that—no matter who wins the Clone Wars or what the future holds—there will one day be a new hope.
| LineColor       = E0BD11
}}
}}
Notes
References
